section.title: Overview
section.p: This use case demonstrates the ability of NCC to support Sy to an OCS. PCRF can check the usage related information for the subscriber at attachment time and receive notifications of changes to the subscriber usage and defined QoS policy based on the information from the OCS (counters and their states).

ul.li: Verify that NCC responds to the Packet Gateway (PGW) with a policy.

note.p: NCC must be installed with policy and charging components combined. Ensure that after creating a record, you distribute it to ME. Otherwise, the provisioning will not be successful.
A route and peer is required for Sy. Two direct connections are used for two OCS systems.

ol.li: Create a device named iPhone6 and enable the Sy parameters as shown in the following figure. To do this, log in to the SM GUI and navigate to Subscriber Manager and select Devices tab. Click to create a device.

Create a counter and attach device with this counter. To do this, navigate to Policy & Charging Configuration and select Common tab. Select Counters from the drop-down list. Click to create a counter.

To attach the counter created to the device, from SM GUI, navigate to Subscriber Manager and select Devices tab. Search the device and click Add counter option as shown in the following figure.
The Add/Remove Counter window is displayed. Select the counter created from the drop-down list and click Save.
